segments.text: The woman is completely oblivious to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing in that puddle, drying dishes like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t tell if she’s ignoring the mess or genuinely doesn’t see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress is probably getting wet, but she doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what she’s thinking about that’s so absorbing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Maybe she’s just exhausted and on autopilot.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are taking advantage of her distraction.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for her, though—this is going to be a nightmare to clean up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is already seeping into the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she snaps out of it soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
